meanings.definition: To take away the virginity of; to deprive of virginity.
meanings.sent1: The cruel man deflowered the innocent girl against her will.
meanings.sent2: The knight deflowered the princess when he kissed her.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fairy deflowered the garden by plucking all the flowers.
meanings.sent4: The storm deflowered the peaceful meadow, leaving it barren and desolate.
meanings.sent5: The ruthless invader deflowered the land, leaving destruction in his wake.

meanings.definition: To despoil of beauty, freshness, or purity; to corrupt.
meanings.sent1: The graffiti deflowered the pristine walls of the building.
meanings.sent2: The gossip deflowered her reputation with false stories.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy deflowered the neatly arranged room by scattering toys everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The pollution deflowered the once clear river, turning it murky and foul.
meanings.sent5: The harsh criticism deflowered her confidence, leaving her feeling insecure.
